meanings.sent1: The tree had branched limbs reaching out in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The bush had many branched stems growing from its base.
meanings.sent3: The branched pattern of veins on the leaf looked like a tiny road map.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts branched out like a complex network of interconnected ideas.
meanings.sent5: The branched antlers of the deer stood out against the forest backdrop.

meanings.sent1: The river flowed through the branched channels of the delta.
meanings.sent2: The lightning struck the branched tree, splitting it in two.
meanings.sent3: The branched paths in the maze confused the lost travelers even more.
meanings.sent4: The branched cracks on the wall indicated structural damage.
meanings.sent5: The branched design of the necklace added an elegant touch to her outfit.

meanings.definition: To divide into branches or offshoots.
meanings.sent1: She branched the conversation into different topics to keep it interesting.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to branch out into new markets to increase profits.
meanings.sent3: He branched off from the main road and took a shortcut through the woods.
meanings.sent4: The river branched off into smaller streams as it meandered through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The idea branched into various innovative solutions during the brainstorming session.
